results.description:
BURDOCK PRESENTS... PIANO FEST 2026

SPONSORED BY YAMAHA

The fan-favourite festival returns: Yamaha provides the Baby Grand Piano on stage, and Burdock brings the finest talent from Toronto and beyond to make beautiful music with it. 

FULL SCHEDULE:

Monday, January 19: Ezra Jordan w/ Jesse Northey
Tuesday, January 20: Ale Nunez & Thompson Egbo-Egbo
Wednesday, January 21: Mirrorball at the Music Hall w/ Farah Lea, Divine Lightbody and Propter Hawk (Presented by NXNE)
Thursday, January 22: Eve Egoyan w/ Kasra Faridi
Friday, January 23: Kevin Hearn w/ Alli Sunshine
Saturday, January 24: Marie Dresselhuis w/ Nate Daviau
Sunday, January 25: In The Starlight w/ Alex Laurie, Maggie Keogh and Mileena (Presented by Guest List TO)

results.name: In The Starlight: Alex Laurie, Maggie Keogh, Mileena & Mister Patsy
results.subtitle: Burdock Presents: Piano Fest 2026

venue.name: Burdock Music Hall
venue.description: The Burdock Music Hall is an independent music and events venue in Toronto, ON.
venue.default_refund_policy: We do not offer refunds for any ticket purchases at Burdock Music Hall.

results.description:
BURDOCK PRESENTS... PIANO FEST 2026

SPONSORED BY YAMAHA

The fan-favourite festival returns: Yamaha provides the Baby Grand Piano on stage, and Burdock brings the finest talent from Toronto and beyond to make beautiful music with it. 

FULL SCHEDULE:

Monday, January 19: Ezra Jordan w/ Jesse Northey
Tuesday, January 20: Ale Nunez & Thompson Egbo-Egbo
Wednesday, January 21: Mirrorball at the Music Hall w/ Farah Lea, Divine Lightbody and Propter Hawk (Presented by NXNE)
Thursday, January 22: Eve Egoyan w/ Kasra Faridi
Friday, January 23: Kevin Hearn w/ Alli Sunshine
Saturday, January 24: Marie Dresselhuis w/ Nate Daviau
Sunday, January 25: In The Starlight w/ Alex Laurie, Maggie Keogh, Mileena & Mister Patsy (Presented by Guest List TO)

BIOS: 

Alex Laurie

Alex Laurie is a Toronto-based musician and producer with a storied history playing many diﬀerent genres and roles within the industry. His own songs stripped down to a solo set through piano and voice convey a vibrant and dynamic life full of longing, loss, excitement, beauty, humor, and mystery. / Instagram

 

Mileena

Alchemist and lover by nature, Mileena is a Tkaronto based singer-songwriter. Inspired by the sensuality and groove of neo-soul, attitude of hip-hop and dub her songwriting is poignant in its representation of the trials and tribulations of relationships, familial, platonic and romantic and the friction that exists between them. / Instagram

Mister Patsy

Toronto-based songwriter Mister Patsy (affectionately known as Patrick Dilkie by census workers and bounty hunters) uses music as a truth serum: only an honest word can carry melody.

His songs are a record of moments of understanding and emotional crystallization that reject the choice between levity and gravity, instead choosing to take whimsy very seriously. 

In the songwriting traditions of Rufus Wainwright, Tom Waits, and Joni Mitchell, his music is harmonically rich, grounded in experience and powerfully vulnerable. / Instagram

venue.name: Burdock Music Hall
venue.description: The Burdock Music Hall is an independent music and events venue in Toronto, ON.
venue.default_refund_policy: We do not offer refunds for any ticket purchases at Burdock Music Hall.

results.description:
New Hue is the artistic project of the 24-year-old multi-instrumentalist, singer, and songwriter Jakob Russell. He blends elements of bedroom pop and indie music to create an optimistic and relaxing sound. He spends his musical time sitting in the comfort of his bedroom, writing and recording his music. He released his first EP titled "Letters From a Loved One" at the start of 2024. He wrote, played all the instruments, except the drums, and recorded everything at home. Since then, he has been inspired to continue writing and recording music, his own music.

New Hue - Instagram

Evyn Barridge - Instagram

results.name: enemies, lovers with Benji Crane & Lucy Ellis
results.subtitle: enemies, lovers headlines Burdock Music Hall for a night of indie/pop music with guests Benji Crane and Lucy Ellis.

venue.name: Burdock Music Hall
venue.description: The Burdock Music Hall is an independent music and events venue in Toronto, ON.
venue.default_refund_policy: We do not offer refunds for any ticket purchases at Burdock Music Hall.

results.description:
enemies, lovers is an indie/pop band based in Toronto led by singer-songwriter, Hatley Edmonds, and guitarist and producer, Marcus Gwyn-Neumann. The group formed in 2023 and released their debut EP, What You Wanted, in 2024. For two years, the band has performed across Toronto to sold-out audiences, including at NXNE and Sofar Sounds. Their sound is a blend of country, rock, pop, and folk, supported by honest, heartfelt lyrics that resonate deeply with their audience. Their unique sound and upbeat stage presence has drawn comparisons to Maggie Rogers, Julia Jacklin, and Kacy Hill. Hatley and Marcus are now working on their debut full-length album.

enemies, lovers / Instagram

Benji Crane / Instagram

Lucy Ellis / Instagram

results.name: Colin Asuncion Live at Burdock

venue.description: The Burdock Music Hall is an independent music and events venue in Toronto, ON.
venue.default_refund_policy: We do not offer refunds for any ticket purchases at Burdock Music Hall.

results.description:
Singer and media personality Colin Asuncion is performing at Burdock on January 30! Colin will sing originals off his EP, Open Up, as well as pop, soul, and R&B covers. Joining him onstage will be Kevin Wong on keys and Colin Story on guitar.

About Colin

Colin Asuncion is a Toronto based singer and performer. He has performed onstage with Jully Black, Divine Brown, Jackie Richardson, and other prolific Canadian singers. Colin is also a Canadian media personality, having appeared on The Social (CTV), The Great Canadian Baking Show (CBC, Netflix Canada), Breakfast Television Toronto, Sirius XM, and The After Show (MTV Canada). His debut EP, Open Up, covers love, lust, and a celebration of Pride.
Follow him on all social media @colinasuncion

results.name: Writers Round with Hayden Ryann, Mackenzie Leigh Meyer, Kendra Gabrielle
results.subtitle: Join Hayden Ryann, Mackenzie Leigh Meyer & Kendra Gabrielle for an intimate Nashville-style Writers Round Jan 31.

venue.name: Burdock Music Hall
venue.description: The Burdock Music Hall is an independent music and events venue in Toronto, ON.
venue.default_refund_policy: We do not offer refunds for any ticket purchases at Burdock Music Hall.

results.description:
Hayden Ryann
Born and raised in Toronto’s Beaches neighborhood, Hayden Ryann is a rising country-pop force known for her raw honesty and infectious energy. Blending modern lyrical directness with the warmth of classic country storytelling, she has been hailed as one of 2026’s breakout artists. Fresh off the success of her empowering anthem "No Room for Bitchin'" and her new single "Cowboy," Hayden delivers a live set that feels both vulnerable and defiant, echoing the spirit of artists like Maggie Rogers and Lizzy McAlpine.

Instagram / Facebook / Twitter / Bluesky / YouTube / BandsInTown

Mackenzie Leigh Meyer
Known as the "Dive Bar Diva," Mackenzie Leigh Meyer is a two-time CMA Ontario Roots Artist of the Year. Originally from Hamilton and now based in the GTA, she has shared stages with country stars like Robyn Ottolini and performed at major festivals like Boots and Hearts. Mackenzie’s music—including hits like "Dial Tone" and "Barbie Doll"—combines soulful vocals with a sharp, contemporary wit. Whether she’s behind a piano or an acoustic guitar, her storytelling is as authentic as the dive bars that inspired her moniker.

Instagram / Facebook / TikTok / YouTube

Kendra Gabrielle
A Mississauga-based artist with a "girl’s girl" vibe, Kendra Gabrielle brings a refreshing, unapologetic lens to the country-pop space. Classically trained at the Royal Conservatory of Music, she translates her 20-something experiences into relatable anthems like "Drunk on My Own" and "Red," which have earned her nominations at the Mississauga Music Awards and airplay on SiriusXM. Drawing influence from Taylor Swift and Shania Twain, Kendra’s mission is simple: to make every audience member feel like they’re listening to their best friend.

Facebook / Instagram / TikTok / YouTube

results.name: Lauryn Macfarlane Live at Burdock Music Hall
results.subtitle: An acoustic and dreamy evening at the Burdock music hall. Come get cozy and listen to the songs and stories of artist Lauryn Macfarlane.

venue.name: Burdock Music Hall
venue.description: The Burdock Music Hall is an independent music and events venue in Toronto, ON.
venue.default_refund_policy: We do not offer refunds for any ticket purchases at Burdock Music Hall.

results.description:
Somewhere between, Alt-Country, indie pop and Singer/songwriter, emerging artist Lauryn Macfarlane is paving her own path in today's music industry. Originally from Peterborough, ON, Lauryn spent her 2015-2018 years enrolled in a Music Business Management program at Durham College in Oshawa, ON. After graduation, she moved to Montreal, QC and began getting involved in the local music scene. In 2019, Lauryn began working alongside producer/engineer Sam Woywitka (Luca Fogale, Half Moon Run) and musicians Isaac Symonds (Half Moon Run), Mishka Stein (Patrick Watson), and Robbie Kuster (Patrick Watson).

In December 2020, Lauryn’s debut single, “Friendly” was released via IndiePool and was featured on Spotify editorial playlist New Music Friday Canada, where she garnered the attention of booking agent Adam Countryman from Artist Group International. It wasn’t long after this that Lauryn signed with Adam to be an act under his roster. Due to COVID, Lauryn was not able to see the full benefits of having an experienced booking agent but was able to be booked for Ottawa Bluesfest and the Peterborough Folk Festival in 2021.

In August 2021, Lauryn Macfarlane was named the Peterborough Folk Festival’s 2021 Emerging Artist (https://bit.ly/3shRaRi)
In the summer of 2022, Thanks to support from FACTOR (Artist development) and SOCAN (Socan LA house) Lauryn had the opportunity to go to LA and work with Grammy award winning Montreal born producer Jason Kellner. It was there she wrote and recorded “Dive” which was released in 2023.
Lauryn just released her debut EP “No Mercy” back in October 2025. No Mercy was recorded in Winnipeg Manitoba with producer/artist Roman Clarke (Brothers Landreth, Boy Golden, Taylor Janzen) and is excited to bring these songs on the road.

Instagram / Facebook / YouTube / TikTok / Twitter

results.name: Sophie Ogilvie / Aniqa Dear / His His at Burdock Music Hall
results.subtitle: Join us for an evening of songs with three bands: Sophie Ogilvie, aniqa dear, and His His.

venue.name: Burdock Music Hall
venue.description: The Burdock Music Hall is an independent music and events venue in Toronto, ON.
venue.default_refund_policy: We do not offer refunds for any ticket purchases at Burdock Music Hall.

results.description:
Sophie Ogilvie is a singer and songwriter based in Montréal, Quebec. Approaching songwriting with the confessional lyricism of folk and an indie rock penchant for pop song structures, Ogilvie’s sound is set apart by her deft command of the voice. On her sophomore EP Resignations, Ogilvie matches harsh guitar tones with rich, sultry vocals. Instagram

His His is the recording project of Toronto-based artist Aidan Belo. He combines elements of Greenwich Village-inspired folk, contemporary indie folk, coupled with low fidelity analog production to create something that sounds honest and melancholic. Since the first His His release in late 2020, this project has generated more than 500,000 streams across Spotify, Apple Music, and YouTube Music, and has been featured on Indie88. Everything was recorded in the empty space of an old wood barn on his family’s farm which has been temporarily converted into a makeshift studio, where everything is recorded entirely to 1⁄4 inch tape and cassette. His His made their live debut at POP International Music Festival 2022 in Montreal. Instagram

aniqa dear is the Toronto based experimental electronic art pop project stemming from the Pakistani/Indian and Arabic influences of songwriter and artist Aniqa Qadir. It is rooted in queerness, migration, otherness, rebirth, and the eternally intertwining dance between belonging and isolation. aniqa dear asks intently if you have ever danced into your own abyss, and she invites you in. Instagram

results.description:
Bad Baby and Mayme Joach are a tricky and wilful band; Aidan McConnell, Jack Johnston, Evan Cartwright, Charliecello Lukashevsky and Alex Lukashevsky; a smoky intergenerational blend of experimental folk, blues, and rock n roll. Akin to Doctor John, Don Van Vliet and Mingus, but most definitely Toronto music. Check out their recent album on Tin Angel Records.

Alex "Bad Baby" Lukashevsky - Instagram

Fan Wu - Instagram

Colleen Coco Collins - Instagram
results.description_without_html:
Bad Baby and Mayme Joach are a tricky and wilful band; Aidan McConnell, Jack Johnston, Evan Cartwright, Charliecello Lukashevsky and Alex Lukashevsky; a smoky intergenerational blend of experimental folk, blues, and rock n roll. Akin to Doctor John, Don Van Vliet and Mingus, but most definitely Toronto music. Check out their recent album on Tin Angel Records.
Alex "Bad Baby" Lukashevsky - Instagram
Fan Wu - Instagram
Colleen Coco Collins - Instagram

results.name: Takes a Village w/ Tylor Jay Santos
results.subtitle: Another evening of drinks, music, and good company.

venue.name: Burdock Music Hall
venue.description: The Burdock Music Hall is an independent music and events venue in Toronto, ON.
venue.default_refund_policy: We do not offer refunds for any ticket purchases at Burdock Music Hall.

results.description:
Good Company is a new monthly showcase hosted by Takes a Village Music.

Takes a Village Music is a Toronto-based collective of rotating artists, producers, and musicians, led by producer and creative director HMLT (Corey Wong). At its core, the project is about building community—creating a space where creatives can gather, connect, and make music together. The group’s catalogue is born from a weekly session known as “Potluck,” where different artists come together to contribute their own flavour.

The roster is ever-changing, featuring contributions from artists such as Eric Ryan, kaiyel, Nilo Blues, Winnie Wong, Chara Kai-Le, Keanu Richal, Koladae, Sonya Tsu, and many more. Every track is produced and curated under the guidance of HMLT, ensuring a distinct yet ever-expanding musical identity.

Takes a Village Music is more than a band—it’s a living, breathing creative ecosystem where music, food, and community.

Every track is produced and curated under the guidance of HMLT, ensuring a distinct yet ever-expanding musical identity.Takes a Village Music is more than a band—it’s a living, breathing creative ecosystem where music, food, and community.

results.description: Kubla is a Toronto-based singer-songwriter, guitarist, and bandleader. His blend of soul, jazz, rock, and R&B has reached audiences through filmed live performances and two albums which have garnered over 8 million hits worldwide. With artistry that carries the weight of top-notch musicianship and the sensitivity of a poet, Kubla and his bandmates bring something fresh to every stage they play.

results.name: The Bookhouse Boys + Bob: Performed by Potions
results.subtitle: Enter the town of Twin Peaks with music in tribute to Angelo Badalamenti, David Lynch, and Julee Cruise.

venue.name: Burdock Music Hall
venue.description: The Burdock Music Hall is an independent music and events venue in Toronto, ON.
venue.default_refund_policy: We do not offer refunds for any ticket purchases at Burdock Music Hall.

results.description:
There are many stories in Twin Peaks. Some of them are sad, some funny. Some of them are stories of madness, of violence. Some are ordinary. Yet they all have about them a sense of mystery – the mystery of life. Sometimes, the mystery of death. The mystery of the woods. The woods surrounding Twin Peaks.

To introduce this story, let me just say it encompasses the all – it is beyond the "fire", though few would know that meaning. It is a story of many, but begins with one – and I knew her. The one leading to the many is Laura Palmer. Laura is the one.

On February 15th, The Bookhouse Boys will guide us in to the deep dark woods with a set of music celebrating Angelo Badalamenti, David Lynch, and Julee Cruise.

And potions will perform “Bob”.

Come to The Burdock Music Hall on February 15th and find these things to be true.

The Bookhouse Boys - EPK
Harry Bartlett - Instagram
Bjorn Kriel - Instagram

Potions - Instagram

It is a story of many, but begins with one – and I knew her. The one leading to the many is Laura Palmer. results.name: Elisa Thorn + Chiquita Magic
results.subtitle: Mind-melters Elisa Thorn (harp/meditative/psychedelic/experimental folk) + Chiquita Magic (electronic/jazz/choral music/synthpop)

venue.name: Burdock Music Hall
venue.description: The Burdock Music Hall is an independent music and events venue in Toronto, ON.
venue.default_refund_policy: We do not offer refunds for any ticket purchases at Burdock Music Hall.

results.description:
Contemporary harpist/vocalist Elisa Thorn (pronounced eh-lee-sah) makes music that drifts easily between folk, pop, jazz, post-rock, and experimental traditions—music she likes to think of as good bath-time listening. Rooted in curiosity and accessibility, her practice embraces unconventional sound worlds while inviting listeners in with warmth and openness. An avid collaborator, Thorn has spearheaded projects including Gentle Party, HUE, and The Giving Shapes, and has contributed to recordings and performances with artists such as Haley Blais, Ora Cogan, Loscil, Khari McClelland, Wallgrin, and Mauvey. Thorn is currently focused on her solo project, which debuted with her album xiik in November 2025. Instagram

chiquitamagic is a Colombian born producer & artist. Her music can be described as electronic dance music with elements of jazz, funk, choral music, & synthpop. She recently released her sixth album CURSI. Her collaborators include Louis Cole, Genevieve Artadi, KNOWER, Justin Brown, Ambrose Akinmusire, MonoNeon, Jake Sherman, Bernice, Anaïs Maviel, David Binney, John Hollenbeck. Instagram

results.name: David James Allen & The Growing Machine with Geordie Gordon

venue.name: Burdock Music Hall
venue.description: The Burdock Music Hall is an independent music and events venue in Toronto, ON.
venue.default_refund_policy: We do not offer refunds for any ticket purchases at Burdock Music Hall.

results.description:
David James Allen brings his one-person band The Growing Machine to Burdock Music Hall Feb 19 — cosmic country & modern Americana.

With his latest single “Platform No. 12 (Old Friends),” Canadian singer/songwriter and multi-instrumentalist David James Allen continues to show why he is on the cutting edge of Americana. “Platform No. 12 (Old Friends)” is an instant cosmic country classic, and a stunning preview of his next album Jubilation Potpourri, scheduled for release in 2026. It follows Allen’s previous album By The Summertime, which Quality Americana described as “a throwback to sounds of the 1970s… the instrumentation is carefully planned, yet feels spontaneous.”

David James Allen has been releasing music for more than a decade, but over the past several years—after moving east of Toronto to the wilds of Prince Edward County—he has been startlingly prolific. Beginning with 2017’s When The Demons Come and carrying on through 2020’s Radiations and the following year’s The Architect, Allen has been steadily amassing a remarkable body of work that stands alongside those of any of his Canadian contemporaries.

Instagram / Facebook / YouTube / TikTok

It follows Allen’s previous album By The Summertime, which Quality Americana described as “a throwback to sounds of the 1970s… the instrumentation is carefully planned, yet feels spontaneous.”David James Allen has been releasing music for more than a decade, but over the past several years—after moving east of Toronto to the wilds of Prince Edward County—he has been startlingly prolific. results.name: Eric Jackson & Willow River
results.subtitle: An evening of country, bluegrass and folk music with multiple CMAO-nominated band, Eric Jackson & Willow River

venue.name: Burdock Music Hall
venue.description: The Burdock Music Hall is an independent music and events venue in Toronto, ON.
venue.default_refund_policy: We do not offer refunds for any ticket purchases at Burdock Music Hall.

results.description:
Eric Jackson & Willow River craft songs that feel like autumn—warm, textured, and timeless. Blending alternative country, bluegrass, and touches of folk/Americana, their music is rooted in harmony-rich storytelling and a deep connection to the land they call home.

Based in Ontario’s Waterloo Region, the band draws its name from the original (pre-colonial) name of the Grand River: Willow River—a tribute to the area’s Indigenous heritage and Eric’s own Métis identity.

Facebook / Instagram / TikTok / YouTube

results.name: Songs at Close Range: NQ Arbuckle, Keri Latimer and Onna Lou
results.subtitle: A rare and intimate songwriter in the round happenstance with 3 critically acclaimed artists.

venue.name: Burdock Music Hall
venue.description: The Burdock Music Hall is an independent music and events venue in Toronto, ON.
venue.default_refund_policy: We do not offer refunds for any ticket purchases at Burdock Music Hall.

results.description:
NQ Arbuckle is a Toronto based songwriter known for his deeply human storytelling and quietly devastating songs. His work balances tenderness and grit, drawing listeners in through emotional honesty and finely crafted detail, and has received widespread critical praise, including multiple JUNO Award nominations. / Instagram / Facebook

Keri Latimer is a Winnipeg-based songwriter, best known as the frontwoman of Leaf Rapids and for her earlier work with Juno Award winning band Nathan. Her songs are observant and searching, often catching listeners off guard with subtly subversive, and at times unexpectedly dark, lyrical turns delivered through a voice described as “liquid silver.” / Instagram / Facebook

Onna Lou is an Argentinian-Canadian artist based in Winnipeg. Trained at Berklee College of Music and Universidad Católica Argentina, she fuses Latin folk with modern sounds. Her album Diamante reached #1 on three Earshot charts and earned her a 2023 Western Canadian Music Awards. Her third album, Quiero verte volar, will be released on all platforms in March 2026, supported by Manitoba Arts Council and Manitoba Film and Music. / Instagram / Facebook

His work balances tenderness and grit, drawing listeners in through emotional honesty and finely crafted detail, and has received widespread critical praise, including multiple JUNO Award nominations. / Instagram / FacebookKeri Latimer is a Winnipeg-based songwriter, best known as the frontwoman of Leaf Rapids and for her earlier work with Juno Award winning band Nathan. Her songs are observant and searching, often catching listeners off guard with subtly subversive, and at times unexpectedly dark, lyrical turns delivered through a voice described as “liquid silver.” / Instagram / FacebookOnna Lou is an Argentinian-Canadian artist based in Winnipeg. Trained at Berklee College of Music and Universidad Católica Argentina, she fuses Latin folk with modern sounds. Her album Diamante reached #1 on three Earshot charts and earned her a 2023 Western Canadian Music Awards. Her third album, Quiero verte volar, will be released on all platforms in March 2026, supported by Manitoba Arts Council and Manitoba Film and Music. / Instagram / Facebook

results.name: Minor Gold (AUS) and The New World Warblers
results.subtitle: Cosmic-folk duo Minor Gold (AUS) album launch + The New World Warblers.

venue.name: Burdock Music Hall
venue.description: The Burdock Music Hall is an independent music and events venue in Toronto, ON.
venue.default_refund_policy: We do not offer refunds for any ticket purchases at Burdock Music Hall.

results.description:
Cosmic-folk duo Minor Gold (AUS) album launch + The New World Warblers.

Minor Gold - ARIA-nominated songwriters Tracy McNeil (CAN) & Dan Parsons (AUS) - embark on their North American album tour for their sophomore album Way to the Sun: a lush, harmony-drenched blend of cosmic country and folk.

Produced by Dan Horne (Mapache, Cass McCombs), Way to the Sun was hailed by UNCUT as “Trippy folk wonderment...the pair have an alluring telepathy, rarely heard since Emmylou & Gram,” crowned Best New Music for July 2025, and held in the top 50 Americana Radio charts for 9 weeks.

Recorded over seven sun-soaked days at Ultimate Hair Farm in Glendale, California, the album slowly emerged like a hazy mirage from a cosmic, suburban dream. Written across Australian highways and finished in Middle America, it’s a bold evolution - seeking light in the shadows, and letting go just enough to watch the sun rise.

After three years of international touring and festival appearances across North America, the UK, and Europe, Minor Gold are back - bringing their irresistible live show and new songs to North American audiences in 2026.

“a confident, cohesive, and compelling chapter… a quietly radiant gem.” — Rhythms Magazine (AUS)

★★★★ — Shindig (UK)
★★★★ — The Australian
★★★★ — Rhythms Magazine (AUS)
★★★★★ — Folk/Tumble “a joyous listen from beginning to end.” (UK)

"Retro California sounds brought bang-up to date" - AmericanaUK


Opening the show are special guests, The New World Warblers.

The New World Warblers are the close-harmony folk duo featuring Logan McNeil and Les Armstrong. Blending the sweetness of the Everly Brothers with the grit of classic bluegrass greats like the Stanley Brothers, they craft original picking tunes and songs rooted in tradition. With mandolin, guitar, and two voices locked tight, the Warblers explore what it means to be a “new” old-time act--honoring the past while carving out a sound all their own.

A night of acoustic duo, harmony bliss, not to be missed!

Minor Gold - Instagram / Website / YouTube
The New World Warblers - Instagram
results.description_without_html:
Cosmic-folk duo Minor Gold (AUS) album launch + The New World Warblers.
Minor Gold - ARIA-nominated songwriters Tracy McNeil (CAN) & Dan Parsons (AUS) - embark on their North American album tour for their sophomore album Way to the Sun: a lush, harmony-drenched blend of cosmic country and folk.Produced by Dan Horne (Mapache, Cass McCombs), Way to the Sun was hailed by UNCUT as “Trippy folk wonderment...the pair have an alluring telepathy, rarely heard since Emmylou & Gram,” crowned Best New Music for July 2025, and held in the top 50 Americana Radio charts for 9 weeks.Recorded over seven sun-soaked days at Ultimate Hair Farm in Glendale, California, the album slowly emerged like a hazy mirage from a cosmic, suburban dream. Written across Australian highways and finished in Middle America, it’s a bold evolution - seeking light in the shadows, and letting go just enough to watch the sun rise.After three years of international touring and festival appearances across North America, the UK, and Europe, Minor Gold are back - bringing their irresistible live show and new songs to North American audiences in 2026.“a confident, cohesive, and compelling chapter… a quietly radiant gem.” — Rhythms Magazine (AUS)★★★★ — Shindig (UK)★★★★ — The Australian★★★★ — Rhythms Magazine (AUS)★★★★★ — Folk/Tumble “a joyous listen from beginning to end.” (UK)"Retro California sounds brought bang-up to date" - AmericanaUKOpening the show are special guests, The New World Warblers.The New World Warblers are the close-harmony folk duo featuring Logan McNeil and Les Armstrong. Blending the sweetness of the Everly Brothers with the grit of classic bluegrass greats like the Stanley Brothers, they craft original picking tunes and songs rooted in tradition. With mandolin, guitar, and two voices locked tight, the Warblers explore what it means to be a “new” old-time act--honoring the past while carving out a sound all their own.A night of acoustic duo, harmony bliss, not to be missed!
